Manager - Advice & Education

Company Name WillowBlue Consulting Pty Ltd Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 12 hours ago Number of views 16 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Join one of Australia’s Award-Winning Industry Superannuation funds \xa0
  • Key role in driving the Fund’s strategic growth initiatives
  • Strong leadership role with change management focus

\xa0

Located in Melbourne, our client has a strong sense of purpose, clear vision, pragmatic strategies and emotionally compelling goals that will inspire you to be part of their journey and envisioned future. \xa0With a long-standing history in the Industry Fund sector and big aspirations for their future, they work for some of the hardest working superannuants in Australia. Committed to building a respected, high performing and progressive Fund, our client recognises the key to achieving their corporate goals will only be made possible through its people and hiring the right talent.

\xa0

A pragmatic thinker and influential leader, you will:

\xa0

  • Lead the advice and education teams to deliver a seamless multi-channel advice offering that drives membership growth and retention.
  • Oversee the development and delivery of appropriate educational activities for employers, members and stakeholders to further their understanding of products and services.
  • Have exceptional sales strategy development and business-planning skills to ensure the Fund delivers on its growth objectives.
  • Work closely with the project team to improve back-end processes to scale up advice. \xa0
  • Develop and uplift capability across the advice practice and member services team ensuring compliance with all regulatory and internal policy requirements.
  • \xa0Act as the technical subject matter expert for advisers and, as necessary, provide specialist advice.

\xa0

Reasons for joining our client

\xa0

  • You will be joining an Industry Super Fund committed to the best interest of members.
  • There is a real opportunity to make a difference and create value to ordinary Australians for dignity in retirement.
  • There is a robust culture that is authentically lived by the Leadership team.
  • The Fund is undergoing a major transformation journey to modernise the Fund. You will play an integral role in creating value for their members. Members are at the core of decision-making.
  • Our client recognises that the best way to develop the Fund is to develop its people by helping them grow and enhance their potential. \xa0They offer on-going education and training.
  • You will be joining an organisation with a people first mentality. Our client recognises the contribution of its employees and rewards their staff with a dedicated range of attractive benefits. \xa0There is a genuine commitment to work/life balance.

What you bring to the role

\xa0

  • A proven track record of success in a role with significant leadership experience within wealth management, financial planning or superannuation.
  • A passion for delivering a service in a values-led organisation that genuinely believes in putting members first.
  • A deep understanding of current issues around financial advice and different business models that will enable the Fund to achieve success.
  • Relevant tertiary qualifications in business or commerce, post-graduate qualifications preferable.
  • Strong analytical thinking ability including systematic problem solving, setting priorities and effectively managing time.
  • High-level interpersonal skills including the ability to build productive working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills and expertise presenting to senior stakeholders.
  • Excellent organisational skills to meet deadlines with the ability to effectively prioritise and juggle multiple tasks.

\xa0

Next Steps

If you would like to have a confidential discussion to learn more about this role, please contact ROZ SHAW on 0457 120 550 or 8679 4150 or alternatively to be considered for this role “APPLY NOW” with your resume and covering letter (in Word format only).

\xa0

You must have full rights to work in Australia to be considered for this opportunity.

\xa0

Security Architect

Company Name Aleron Security Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 80 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Position: Full-Time or Contract

Seniority/Experience Level: 6+ years’ experience in similar role

Location: Sydney CBD

Competitive Remuneration Package

\xa0

At Aleron, we’re about thinking creatively to solve security-related challenges in ways that make a demonstrable difference to our customers. We’re not about ticking boxes. We’re about working with our customers’ needs at the heart of everything we do.

\xa0

We’re always looking for likeminded people to join our team. We believe that the people you work with can determine your career success, engagement, and enjoyment. If any of this sounds familiar, we’d love to hear from you.

\xa0

We are on the lookout for a Security Architect to join our passionate and motivated team of consultants. The successful candidate will be adaptable, driven and have excellent communication skills, able to provide assistance and support to our customers and make a contribution to our dynamic organisation.

\xa0

You’re perfect for us if you are:

  • Curious and always looking for new ways to learn and grow
  • Passionate about technology and excited by new technologies
  • Motivated to make a difference for our customers, our business, and the cybersecurity industry
  • A great communicator who enjoys sharing ideas, values teamwork, as well as working independently \xa0
  • Results oriented and thrives on delivering great outcomes for customers
  • Able to inspire others with your creativity, commitment, and energy
  • Driven by a focus on integrity, transparency, and inclusiveness.

\xa0

Responsibilities include:

  • Working closely with customers to provide leadership and support to determine security requirements and provide security solution design and architect solutions to meet these requirements
  • Conducting system security, vulnerability analyses and risk assessments, using strong business risk analysis skills to guide the implementation and remediation of risk and security assessment plans and undertaking assessments to resolve architectural implementation concerns that may arise
  • Assessing and evaluating the need for security design policy exemptions. These should detail mitigation strategies and controls and make appropriate recommendations for acceptance/rejection
  • Researching, designing and advocating new technologies, architectures and security products that will support business and security requirements
  • Reviewing IT projects to ensure they meet compliance standards and analyses business impact and exposure based on emerging security threats, vulnerabilities and risks
  • Maintaining security by monitoring and ensuring compliance to standards, policies and procedures, identifying security gaps and upgrading security systems by evaluating and implementing enhancements

\xa0

Skills required:

  • Skills and knowledge in Cloud architecture and design in any of the following:

    AWS, Azure, Softlayer, GCP

  • Understanding and experience with Application Security

  • Strong technical knowledge in security architecture, design and infrastructure and a thorough knowledge of varying security disciplines and technologies
  • Knowledge of security and risk frameworks including ISO-27000 series, SABSA, CISSP, TOGAF
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills with the ability to document and verbally communicate required security solutions and present complex information and designs clearly and concisely

\xa0

When you join us, you’ll get:

  • Unlimited opportunities for career advancement
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • The chance to expand your knowledge through ongoing education and training
  • Mentoring from experienced professionals
  • The ability to make a real difference in a cutting edge and dynamic organisation
  • Competitive remuneration package.

Product Manager, Line Extensions

Company Name Mozilla Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 47 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Firefox Test Pilot’s mission is to research, build, and test experimental features and services that shape the future of the Firefox product ecosystem. Since forming two years ago, our team has produced several widely-used features in Firefox (Screenshots, Containers, Activity Stream), and we’ve recently expanded to mobile services (Firefox Send, Firefox Lockbox). Over the next few years, we will define, develop and mature a high-value product ecosystem that extends Mozilla’s mission beyond browsers and into new product lines.

We are looking for an experienced product leader to identify emerging product opportunities, drive the testing, development and deployment of prototype experiences, and articulate a vision for scaling these new products to extend our ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities
  • Define the vision, strategy, and business cases for early-stage products and services.
  • Facilitate and support lightweight product validation and research.
  • Articulate requirements for MVP testing.
  • Manage and prioritize a backlog of experimental concepts with input from Firefox leadership and community.
  • Drive new products from prototype-stage to large-scale launches.
  • Work with Test Pilot and UR and Design teams identify research to identify and prioritize targets for new product experimentation.
  • Work with Firefox Product and Engineering leadership to identify high-value integration points for new products.
  • Define product goals and build the dashboards to track them.


Preferred Qualifications
  • Strong technical literacy: preferably comfort with Android and modern web-development practices (React/Redux/ES6/CI/GitHub &c.)
  • Working knowledge of user research methodologies and best practices.
  • Experience with lightweight concept validation and qualitative user research methodologies.
  • Experience with quantitative research tools such as MVT and A/B Testing.
  • Experience with surveying tools.


About Mozilla

Mozilla exists to build the Internet as a public resource accessible to all because we believe that open and free is better than closed and controlled. When you work at Mozilla, you give yourself a chance to make a difference in the lives of Web users everywhere. And you give us a chance to make a difference in your life every single day. Join us to work on the Web as the platform and help create more opportunity and innovation for everyone online.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Level: P5

Job description

We have a fantastic opportunity for a Group Audit and Risk Manager to work on 3 days per week arrangement. Reporting to the Group CFO, the Audit and Risk Manager is responsible for regular review of all internal controls within all our brands.
\xa0
Working in close collaboration with the External and Internal Auditors, the role is accountable for ensuring the business maintains and conforms with the internal control framework that has been established to provide senior management with the confidence and reliance that all significant risks are being appropriately managed and controlled. . This will include delivery of quality outcomes in relation to the \xa0internal control framework, risk mitigation, internal audit and external audit recommendations, payment controls, account reconciliations, system access controls and internal compliance monitoring.
\xa0
Key responsibilties:

  • Ensure regular and prescribed operational audits and controls are undertaken in accordance with Group policies and procedures.
  • Present regular audit reports to management verifying the accuracy of transactions and report on other significant findings in relation to operational practices.
  • Help facilitate the internal audit process by acting as a key point of contact in the business for internal auditors and drive the required outcomes identified in the audit findings.
  • Champion controls and compliance within the MMSG business by ensuring that all work practices are aligned with policy, process, contractual and legislative requirements.
  • Ensure payments controls are effective and maintained across the MMSG group.
  • Identify and implement control improvements across the MMSG group
  • Implement a system, bank account, payroll access and review process to ensure only appropriate staff have access at all times.
  • Produce a variety of reports on risk mitigation and identification of improvement opportunities.
You will bring:
  • Strong audit or accounting background with a minimum of 10 years experience leading audit and compliance related functions
  • Proven understanding of compliance and risk management strategies
  • Strong commercial acumen and professional judgement
  • Track record of effective improvement initiatives in ambiguous and emerging environments
  • Ability to influence and generate commitment to the achievement of controls across all levels of the busines
  • Structured, analytical approach to problem solving
  • Proven ability to work to tight deadlines and effectively manage conflicting priorities
  • Pro-actively seeks continuous improvement opportunities

We are flat out in our targeted growth area of Motor Loans. This growth has created a new role for a dynamic and experienced Settlements Manager in Credit Operations.

We’re seeking a natural leader who loves mentoring, coaching and developing. The team are a high performing team of 6 Settlements Officers with varying levels of experience. Some of the day to day tasks are;


  • Manage contract settlement times within agreed service level agreements.
  • Monitor and control irregular documentation and increase productivity of settlement function.

  • Identify, implement and drive process improvement opportunities.

Company Name Accela Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 20 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Why Accela:


Accela has grown to become a leader in cloud-based platforms for government. We offer employees a culture that emphasizes performance, productivity and collaboration. You can’t help but feel empowered, engaged and motivated when you work with like-minded individuals who are driven and passionate about contributing to a market-leading, high-growth software organization with proven technology.

While we are busy changing the world, we also strongly believe in having fun and excitement at work and encourage a collaborative and healthy work-life balance. If you are motivated by the idea of delivering on the promise of democracy in the digital age and solving for a new era of more efficient, open and innovative government, then we’d love to hear from you.

Accela are currently seeking a Pre-Sales Engineer for a position based in Melbourne. The Pre-Sales Engineer is responsible for conducting product demonstrations to potential and current customers and configuring Accela SaaS solutions to reflect target customer’s needs with our software offerings, interfacing regularly with customers and prospects.

Where you fit:


Impact You Will Make In The Role (Responsibilities)
  • Articulate and promote Accela’s technology and product positioning to business and technical customers, prospects and partners
  • Analyze prospect demonstration requirements and develop detailed Accela demonstration scripts
  • Deliver compelling and targeted full solution product demonstrations remotely and in person at prospect site and industry events throughout the country
  • Support customers via onsite and remote account visits and follow up
  • Provide solution-related assistance to other Accela departments and current customers
  • Prepare functional requirements to convey product requirements to engineering, reflecting specific needs of the prospect and install base as a result of discussions and demo script requirements as well as requests from the sales team
  • Work closely with the sales team as a key technic
  • al product advisor and advocate
  • Remain informed of job-related issues through networking, training programs, seminars and trade publications


Expertise You Will Bring In (Skills And Qualifications)
  • Professional presentation skills along with the ability to improvise and adapt to meeting dynamics
  • Ability to analyze and articulate customer business processes
  • Technical ability to process available information in order to deploy and configure SaaS software
  • Ability to effectively communication one on one with software users of all levels and roles
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Use of independent judgment under a minimum supervision
  • Strong organizational and time management skills, the ability to prioritize action items and meet deadlines, work in a team environment, follow written policies and procedures, and maintain superior customer service at all times with all users
  • Experience with similar software solutions
  • Experience selling software solutions to Government
  • Ability to travel throughout the region, at times with minimal advanced notice (travel up to 25% of the time)


Desired Qualifications
  • 3 – 5 years minimum experience in sales and/or software product presentations
  • Bachelor’s degree in a technology, marketing/sales, or communication related field or the equivalent skill and knowledge
  • Knowledge of local/state/federal government business processes in permitting, planning, asset, and enforcement activities, preferred
  • Working experience in engineering or sales of similar software products or in the use of those products in target client base, or a combination of both

Senior Systems Engineer

Company Name ThinkMarkets Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 9 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Senior Systems Engineer’s role is to ensure the stability, integrity, and efficient operation of the in-house information systems that support core organizational functions. This is achieved by monitoring, maintaining, supporting, and optimizing all networked software and associated operating systems. The Senior Systems Engineers will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help identify, communicate, and resolve issues in order to maximize the benefit of IT systems investments. Those individuals will also mentor and provide guidance to the Systems Engineering staff.

\xa0

Responsibilities


Strategy & Planning


\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Collaborate with network staff to ensure smooth and reliable operation of software and systems for fulfilling business objectives and processes.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Work with executive team members, decision makers, and stakeholders to define business requirements and systems goals, and to identify and resolve business systems issues.

\xa0

Acquisition & Deployment


\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Design and deploy new applications and enhancements to existing applications, software, and operating systems.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Perform cost-benefit and return on investment analyses for proposed systems to aid management in making implementation decisions.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Conduct research on software and systems products to justify recommendations and to support purchasing efforts.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Interact and negotiate with vendors, outsourcers, and contractors to secure system-related products and services.

\xa0

Operational Management


\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Gauge the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems; develop and implement strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Propose and create system design models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to system programmer and development teams.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Design and perform server and security audits, system backup procedures, and other recovery processes in accordance with the company’s disaster recovery and business continuity strategies.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Integrate servers, including database, e-mail, print, and backup servers and their associated software into enterprise systems.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Ensure system connectivity of all servers, shared software, groupware, and other applications.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Create and maintain documentation as it relates to system configuration, mapping, processes, and service records.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Ensure compatibility and interoperability of in-house computing systems.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Coordinate and perform in-depth tests, including end-user reviews, for modified and new systems.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Monitor and test system performance; prepare and deliver system performance statistics and reports.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Provide orientation and training to end users for all modified and new systems.


Position Requirements


Knowledge & Experience


\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Proven experience in overseeing the design, development, and implementation of software systems, applications, and related products.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Proven experience with systems planning, security principles, and general software management best practices.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Excellent understanding of the organization’s goals and objectives.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Good project management skills.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Ability to conduct research into systems issues and products as required.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Ability to communicate ideas in both technical and user-friendly language.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Highly self-motivated and directed, with keen attention to detail.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Proven analytical and creative problem-solving abilities.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Able to prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Strong customer service orientation.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Ability to work in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.

\xa0

Required Skills


\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 VMware Virtualization, Windows/Linux Servers Troubleshooting, Disaster Recovery, Networking, Windows Server Active Directory, Security Systems Engineering, Cisco Technologies, DNS, Technical Support, Cloud Computing, Microsoft Exchange, SAN, Scripting Languages (PowerShell, Bash, VBScript, Python)

Education

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 The Systems Engineer will have a bachelor’s degree and 5 years of System Engineering experience, associate degree and 10 years related experience, or 15 years related experience.

\xa0

We're growing at the rate of 30 restaurants a year and we want to attract new operations talent that can grow with us. If you're passionate about delivering an exceptional guest experience, believe in the power of people and developing your team and are passionate about good quality fresh food, this opportunity Is for you!


The Role

Reporting to the Operations Manager, this role will see you lead, coach, and support various Franchisees or Restaurant Managers and their teams in your allocated area to ensure they meet and exceed GYG's standards of guest experience, operations, and quality. There is also a strong focus in developing strategies to increase sales and profitability and working with franchisees on people management and guest experience.

This role will suit an individual with a restaurant or QSR multi-site management background who is passionate about leadership, continuous improvement and is motivated to promote GYG's values and energy.

Job description

The Organisation


Our client is a global top-tier professional services firm with offices across Europe, the Americas and Asia-Pacific. It is a trusted partner to some of largest brands around the world and is actively pursuing a global growth strategy.



The Opportunity\xa0


The Head of Finance, Australia & NZ is responsible for the management of the finance operations across Australia. In addition, this role will also oversee New Zealand entities created to enable work to be performed across the Tasman.
Reporting to the CFO, this role will demonstrate capability and passion to enhance business performance through commercial insights and active management of key business drivers. As a senior member of the Australian core services team and commercial business partner, this role will work closely with the Australian Managing Partner and the Australian Functional Heads.



Responsibilities

Leadership

  • Building and maintaining a high-performance finance team culture with a reputation for commercial excellence whilst being a trusted advisor to the Australian Management team.


Financial Control
  • Oversee the monthly Management account reporting for the Australia and New Zealand region into group finance and oversee financial reporting processes whilst ensuring compliance with IFRS standards.


Budgeting and Forecasting
  • Oversee the budget and forecast preparation for Australia and provide financial analysis and reporting of key performance metrics in the support of development of long-range plans.


Compliance
  • Oversee all regulatory finance matters, annual audits, tax filings and issuing of dividends whilst liaising closely with auditors.


Treasury
  • Drive best practice working capital management, maintaining oversight of ongoing cash forecasting ensuring credit risk management.


Commercial Support
  • Ongoing economic assessment of Australia as a region tracking to the strategic growth plan and other investments, advising on expansion or mitigation opportunities and identifying areas for process improvement,
  • Partnering with the business to ensure that the finance team provides value adding analysis that relates directly to delivering strategic objectives.



Experience

  • Experience leading an accounting function of a complex business (professional services experience highly regarded).
  • Demonstrated leadership experience, with strong coaching and mentoring skills.
  • Successfully integrated finance teams within internationally matrixed organisations, ideally having progressed from Big 4 / Major Mid-Tier Audit into an industry role,
  • Expert knowledge of IFRS accounting principles, practices and procedures.
  • Well versed on tax legislation, with outstanding familiarity on local tax authority lodgement requirements and deadlines.


Qualifications

  • Undergraduate degree in Accounting and/or related discipline.
  • CA/CPA qualified with at least 15 years’ experience post qualification.
  • Master’s degree in Business Administration or similar.
  • Evidence of ongoing study and continuous personnel development particularly around Leadership in a high-performance culture.

Unified Comms Technician

Company Name Vocus Group Limited Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 16 hours ago Number of views 18 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We’re looking for switched on, energetic and highly motivated individuals eager to work in a fast paced and close-knit team. We want go getters with fresh ideas who are looking to make a difference and help the team here at Vocus in our efforts to become the Most Loved Telco.
\xa0
We now have an opportunity for a proactive, customer focused individual, to join our Unified Comms team where you’ll be part of the frontline team helping our resellers with their Broadsoft Hosted PBX and SIP Trunking services. This is a great opportunity to further your VoIP skills in a service provider environment that has cutting-edge Unified Communications infrastructure.

A bit about the role

As a Unified Comms Technician, your commitment to delivering superior customer experiences will see you effectively managing customer incidents and requests in our ticketing system to ensure they are completed on time. You will also be liaising with our resellers via email and phone while maintaining the highest levels of customer service. Our Unified Comms Engineering team will be there to develop your knowledge and support you with urgent and complicated tickets.

Skills and Experience


  • Excellent writing and oral communication skills coupled with a customer service orientation
  • High level of initiative to identify and resolve customer issues
  • Organisational skills and the ability to manage conflicting priorities
  • Ability to work individually and as part of a team
  • Understanding of SIP protocol and VoIP technology – Broadsoft experience preferred
  • Knowledge and/or exposure to Cisco routing and switching networks
  • Desire to work in a technical field with the passion and ability to develop your technical skills


Desirable attributes


  • Exposure to a Service Desk environment and working with a ticketing system
  • CCNA or equivalent
  • Proficiency in Linux desirable
  • An understanding of emerging technologies in the communications sphere and their potential commercial applications

Diesel Mechanic

Company Name Horner Company Location Laverton

New Posted Date Posted 17 hours ago Number of views 15 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

This growing business based in Melbourne's inner western suburbs requires an experienced Diesel Mechanic to help service and maintain a wide range of trucks, trailers, forklifts and other machinery.
A supplier of general maintenance services to the transport and shipping industries, this company requires additional staff to help support its busy Melbourne-based workshops.

The Role

This position will be based at the company's main workshop in Melbourne's inner western suburbs, with duties occasionally required at smaller workshops in nearby suburbs.
Repair work will also need to be carried out in the field through use of a service vehicle.
Please note this position will also require you to be rostered on for call-out duties approximately one week per month during which time you will need to be able to attend out-of-hours call-outs. Regular Saturday work is also required.
In this role you will be conducting services, repairs and high-performance tuning as directed by workshop managers. You will be required to supply your own basic tool kit.

About You

You will be experienced in the maintenance of diesel engine vehicles and hydraulic systems, and be able to efficiently and safely undertake necessary preventative maintenance, diagnostics and repair work.
A relevant trade qualification is also essential.
Given the need to be available for work outside normal hours, you must have a flexible approach to work duties.\xa0
With a focus on growing its client base while maintaining excellence in service delivery, this company provides an outstanding opportunity to gain permanent full-time employment as well as develop your career.
To apply for this role please submit your application ASAP by clicking on the 'Apply' button and uploading your CV in Word format.
For a confidential discussion about this position, please call Ben Hutchison at Horner Recruitment on 9335 9999.
\xa0

Desired Skills and Experience

You will be experienced in the maintenance of diesel engine vehicles and hydraulic systems, and be able to efficiently and safely undertake necessary preventative maintenance, diagnostics and repair work.

Call Centre Manager

Company Name Prixcar Services Pty Ltd Company Location 7-20 Horsburgh drive, Altona North, VIC 3025, AU

New Posted Date Posted 17 hours ago Number of views 34 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Work for an Industry Leader
  • Drive Your Team To The Next Level of Performance
  • Immediate Start
  • Great Team Culture

Prixcar Services are one of Australia’s leading automotive logistics providers and since our inception in 1988; our focus has always been on giving our clients the highest quality of service. From vehicle relocation, storage and rectification to commissioning, decommissioning and project management, we are committed to fostering successful business partnerships that help our customers succeed.


We are now seeking a dedicated Call Centre Manager to ensure the delivery of the best possible levels of customer service through our busy call centre operation. Your strong people management skills will be highly regarded as you will be required to be very hands-on with the Customer Interaction Team, coaching, mentoring and monitoring the progress of KPI’s and performance on a day to day basis.

\xa0

The Role:

  • Monitor and support our Call Centre Team Members;
  • Monitor workloads to track performance and respond to escalations ensuring service delivery standards and key performance indicators are being met and maintained;
  • Manage within agreed business protocols, absences and exceptions of the team, including requests for planned leave;
  • Strong relationship management and interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively advocate for the Call Centre and its customers;
  • Be hands on with the daily running of the call centre inclusive of order process, taking phone calls, quoting and general enquiry;
  • Conduct and coordinate coaching and development activities for team members, to ensure staff receive regular performance feedback, information and assistance with their ongoing development.

\xa0

To be successful in this role you will need:

\xa0

  • Previous experience managing a call centre and ensuring compliance with policies and procedures;
  • Demonstrated team and people management skills in order to promote a positive and proactive culture, to motivate, coach, develop and inspire your team;
  • To be motivated and proactive in regards to identifying risks, finding solutions and driving improvements;
  • Take ownership for the role and business function and make recommendations to improve the standard within the business;
  • Be proficient in using Microsoft and call centre applications;
  • Have an eye for detail and the skills to provide an outstanding customer experience;
  • Have an understanding of general operational requirements of a business.

866730684:
[

Paediatric Physiotherapist/Occupational Therapist - Key Worker

Company Name Tradewind Australia Company Location Thornbury, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 18 hours ago Number of views 5 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Tradewind Australia is working in partnership with Melbourne City Mission, a leader and innovator in the provision of services to the community.

Established in 1854, Melbourne City Mission is a non-denominational organisation that provides assistance to thousands of Victorian people and communities experiencing disadvantage.

\xa0

Their Early Childhood Intervention Program is a specialist service for families of children with developmental delays/disabilities.


Working in partnership with families, valuing their skills, knowledge and involvement, the position of Key Worker delivers quality services and supports within a social insurance model that is focused on achieving outcomes.


Duties and responsibilities include:


  • Working within a trans-disciplinary team to provide an Early Intervention service focused on child and family goals and priorities delivered within both universal and specialist support services.
  • Use a family centred and strengths based approach to deliver high quality support to children with a developmental delays/disability.
  • Provide support to children and families through home visits, integrated integration settings, community support, group focused programs and broader early childhood and school settings.
  • Assess, develop and implement planning, therapy and other support strategies to achieve high quality outcomes for the child and family.
  • Monitor, evaluate and clearly define child goals to ensure service effectiveness and continuous improvements through regular review.


The Early Childhood Intervention service is located in Thornbury but offers the opportunity to work flexibly and independently with a self-managed schedule in clients homes and early childhood settings.


The team is made up of specialised allied health disciplines and are goal based with a learning culture and growth focus. Weekly supervision is offered along with professional development training to ensure continuing registration with AHPRA.


The position is offered full time with part time options considered for experienced Physiotherapy or Occupational Therapy practitioners.


A competitive salary is available with the benefit of salary packaging and internal growth opportunities.


\xa0

Apply today for an immediate commencement or for further information or a confidential chat, call Brenda or David on 1800 833 130.
